You are given a string $s$ and an integer $m$.  

You need to choose some positions in the string so that every contiguous substring of length $m$ contains at least one of the chosen positions.  

Then, you can rearrange the characters at the chosen positions to form a new string.

Find the lexicographically smallest possible new string.

You are given a string of letters and a number.  You need to pick some positions in the string so that every group of consecutive letters of length  the given number has at least one of your chosen positions. Then, rearrange the letters at your chosen positions to make the smallest possible new string. What is that string?
